about.name: Lisbon
about.info_text: Lisbon, the capital of Portugal, is a city of timeless charm and vibrant culture. Nestled on the banks of the Tagus River, Lisbon is known for its historic neighborhoods, colorful tiles, and breathtaking views. Visitors can explore the winding streets of Alfama, visit iconic landmarks like Belém Tower, and indulge in delicious Portuguese cuisine. With a rich maritime heritage and a warm Mediterranean climate, Lisbon is a city that invites you to embrace its history and modernity.
about.facts_text:
Population: Approximately 547,000
Region: Lisbon District
Time Zone: Western European Time (UTC+00:00)
Language: Portuguese
Currency: Euro (EUR)
about.climate_text: Lisbon enjoys a Mediterranean climate with mild, rainy winters and warm, dry summers. The city is known for its abundant sunshine and pleasant weather year-round.

attractions_card.title: Belém Tower
attractions_card.description: Belém Tower is a historic fortress and a symbol of Portugal's Age of Discovery, offering picturesque views of the Tagus River.

attractions_card.title: Jerónimos Monastery
attractions_card.description: The Jerónimos Monastery is a UNESCO World Heritage site, known for its stunning Manueline architecture and cultural significance.

attractions_card.title: Alfama District
attractions_card.description: Alfama is Lisbon's oldest neighborhood, characterized by narrow streets, historic buildings, and the São Jorge Castle.

attractions_card.title: Bairro Alto
attractions_card.description: Bairro Alto is a lively district known for its vibrant nightlife, Fado music, and a variety of bars and restaurants.

attractions_card.title: Lisbon Oceanarium
attractions_card.description: The Lisbon Oceanarium is one of the world's largest saltwater aquariums, featuring a diverse range of marine life.

attractions_card.title: Rossio Square
attractions_card.description: Rossio Square is a central square in Lisbon, surrounded by historic buildings, cafes, and a monument to Dom Pedro IV.

attractions_card.title: Lisbon Trams
attractions_card.description: Lisbon's iconic trams, especially Tram 28, offer a charming way to explore the city's streets and hills.

attractions_card.title: Lisbon Cathedral
attractions_card.description: Lisbon Cathedral, also known as Sé de Lisboa, is a Romanesque-style cathedral with historic and religious significance.

food_card.title: Pastéis de Nata
food_card.description: Pastéis de Nata are delicious custard tarts with flaky pastry, a beloved Portuguese pastry enjoyed with coffee.

food_card.title: Bacalhau à Brás
food_card.description: Bacalhau à Brás is a classic Portuguese dish made with salted cod, eggs, and crispy shoestring potatoes.

food_card.title: Francesinha
food_card.description: Francesinha is a hearty sandwich from Porto, often enjoyed in Lisbon, featuring layers of meat, cheese, and a spicy sauce.

food_card.title: Amêijoas à Bulhão Pato
food_card.description: Amêijoas à Bulhão Pato is a popular Portuguese seafood dish, consisting of clams cooked with garlic, cilantro, and white wine.

hotels_card.title: Four Seasons Hotel Ritz Lisbon
hotels_card.description: The Four Seasons Hotel Ritz Lisbon offers luxurious accommodations with stunning views, fine dining, and a spa.

hotels_card.title: Tivoli Avenida Liberdade
hotels_card.description: Tivoli Avenida Liberdade is a grand hotel located on Lisbon's main boulevard, offering elegant rooms and excellent dining options.

hotels_card.title: Memmo Príncipe Real
hotels_card.description: Memmo Príncipe Real is a boutique hotel in the trendy Príncipe Real district, providing stylish rooms and a rooftop bar with panoramic views.

hotels_card.title: Hotel Santa Justa
hotels_card.description: Hotel Santa Justa is a charming hotel located near the historic Santa Justa Elevator, offering cozy accommodations and a central location.

transport_card.title: Lisbon Portela Airport
transport_card.description: Lisbon Portela Airport is the primary international airport serving Lisbon, providing various transportation options to the city center.

transport_card.title: Lisbon Trams and Buses
transport_card.description: Lisbon's tram and bus network offers convenient public transportation, connecting different parts of the city.

transport_card.title: Lisbon Metro
transport_card.description: Lisbon's metro system is an efficient way to get around the city, with multiple lines serving various neighborhoods and attractions.

transport_card.title: Ferries on the Tagus River
transport_card.description: Ferries on the Tagus River provide a scenic way to explore Lisbon and its surroundings, including Cacilhas and Trafaria.

transport_card.title: Lisbon Taxis
transport_card.description: Taxis in Lisbon are readily available and offer a convenient way to reach specific destinations in the city.

transport_card.title: Santa Apolónia Train Station
transport_card.description: Santa Apolónia Train Station is Lisbon's main train station, providing national and international rail connections.

transport_card.title: Lisbon Funiculars
transport_card.description: Lisbon's funiculars, such as the Elevador da Bica, offer a unique way to navigate the city's steep hills.
